item.title: Pt Reyes ’79
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
pt reyes 79, originally uploaded by richardschave. A parking lot in northern California just north of San Francisco on the coast. I believe I soon after this photo purchased the famous Pt. Reyes cow tee-shirt, which I wore, through several newer and bigger sizes through the age of 19 or 20.

The post Pt Reyes ’79 appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
pt reyes 79, originally uploaded by richardschave.

item.title: kitchen circa 1976
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
kitchen circa 1976, originally uploaded by richardschave. This is the kitchen from the house on Rountree in Rancho Park. I remember at some point soon after this photo the brick wall was taken down, with great consternation. The table was replaced by a wooden one which sat six, and had wings for expanding to 10… Continue reading kitchen circa 1976

The post kitchen circa 1976 appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
kitchen circa 1976, originally uploaded by richardschave.

This is the kitchen from the house on Rountree in Rancho Park. I remember at some point soon after this photo the brick wall was taken down, with great consternation. The table was replaced by a wooden one which sat six, and had wings for expanding to 10 & 12. The table was purchased in British Columbia at an antique shop. The table in the photo came from my grandfather’s store, I believe. My mother does not look happy. She has never liked to cook. I think even at this age it was obvious to me that I was going to have to take over making dinner ASAP.

The post kitchen circa 1976 appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.

item.title: environmental education trip 1983?
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
environmental trip, originally uploaded by richardschave. It does not seem possible that this photo was taken when I was in 9th grade, but that is my first memory of using a frame pack. No family holidays required such preparations. The trip took us out into the woods for four days of what I remember as… Continue reading environmental education trip 1983?

The post environmental education trip 1983? appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
environmental trip, originally uploaded by richardschave.

It does not seem possible that this photo was taken when I was in 9th grade, but that is my first memory of using a frame pack. No family holidays required such preparations. The trip took us out into the woods for four days of what I remember as fun and excitement, but I also recall my friends on the trip did not agree. As I remember our group was small, hence the guides decided to take us off the beaten path–they were used to a larger group. Richard Rushfield did not enjoy the trip as I remember, and the guides made fun of us for being so clean cut their our necks got sunburn. My hair looks pretty long, so again, I question my memory.

The post environmental education trip 1983? appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.

item.title: Apple Orchard ABQ., NM
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
photos, originally uploaded by richardschave. Living in the trailer in the corner of an apple orchard in NW Albuquerque. Just off the zanja. Horace rented it to us for $30/month. I believe we were there 2 months. He built his house himself out of adobe brick he made. Worked in the stock yards in the… Continue reading Apple Orchard ABQ., NM

The post Apple Orchard ABQ., NM appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
photos, originally uploaded by richardschave.

Living in the trailer in the corner of an apple orchard in NW Albuquerque. Just off the zanja. Horace rented it to us for $30/month. I believe we were there 2 months. He built his house himself out of adobe brick he made. Worked in the stock yards in the 1960s. Used to get up @ 3am, work on building the house for 90 minutes, then go to work. I liked Horace. He was a good guy. It was a quiet lane. I built an archway and a chimney while we were there for a contractor (his own house) just down the street.

The post Apple Orchard ABQ., NM appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.

item.title: Me & Uncle Joseph
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
wedding photos, originally uploaded by richardschave. A photo of myself and Uncle Joseph Slusky (my aunt’s first husband). He is a gifted metal sculptor. We discuss the finer points of coal forges and our hero, Alfred Jarry. The photo was taken at my sister’s wedding in 2004.

The post Me & Uncle Joseph appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
wedding photos, originally uploaded by richardschave.

A photo of myself and Uncle Joseph Slusky (my aunt’s first husband). He is a gifted metal sculptor. We discuss the finer points of coal forges and our hero, Alfred Jarry. The photo was taken at my sister’s wedding in 2004.

It was during my ford marriage, born of gasoline and good nature, when we were living in a trailer and traveling around the country. I enjoyed building that wall. I know John Fante is… Continue reading Adobe Arch ABQ., NM

The post Adobe Arch ABQ., NM appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
me abq. , NM, originally uploaded by richardschave.

this is a photo taken by my father in ABQ., NM. circa 1995. It was during my ford marriage, born of gasoline and good nature, when we were living in a trailer and traveling around the country. I enjoyed building that wall. I know John Fante is proud of me.

The post Adobe Arch ABQ., NM appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.

item.title: Croquet Party on the Knoll UCSC–1988
item.dc:creator: rss
item.description:
croquet 1989, originally uploaded by richardschave. This photo was taken at my birthday party in 1988. I am standing in front of Nathan Marsak’s hearse. There are other photos from this event which will eventually surface. This photo is of note because it is the quickest way to explain why my wife refused to even… Continue reading Croquet Party on the Knoll UCSC–1988

The post Croquet Party on the Knoll UCSC–1988 appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
item.content:encoded:
croquet 1989, originally uploaded by richardschave.

This photo was taken at my birthday party in 1988. I am standing in front of Nathan Marsak’s hearse. There are other photos from this event which will eventually surface.

This photo is of note because it is the quickest way to explain why my wife refused to even say hello to me even though we were in the same department and shared the same advisor–who confided in me that we were soul mates. I laughed when Jasper told me that. Character is fate, as I remember reading somewhere. . .

The post Croquet Party on the Knoll UCSC–1988 appeared first on 2 or 3 things I Know About Her.
